title: hibernate-orm guide should mention JNDI is disabled
body:
### Describe the bug

Hibernate ORM extension has disabled use of JNDI (https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/22901 for no-op impl, exception before that) 

hibernate-orm guide should mention that JNDI is disabled

Some guides do mention JNDI restrictions:
```
~/git/quarkus/docs:  git grep JNDI
src/main/asciidoc/mongodb.adoc:WARNING: By default Quarkus will restrict the use of JNDI within an application, as a precaution to try and mitigate any future vulnerabilities similar to log4shell.
src/main/asciidoc/mongodb.adoc:Because the `mongo+srv` protocol often used to connect to MongoDB requires JNDI, this protection is automatically disabled when using the MongoDB client extension.
src/main/asciidoc/mongodb.adoc:However, in native, the default DNS resolver, provided by the MongoDB client, uses JNDI and does not work in native mode.
src/main/asciidoc/security-ldap.adoc:WARNING: By default Quarkus will restrict the use of JNDI within an application, as a precaution to try and mitigate any future vulnerabilities similar to log4shell. Because LDAP based auth requires JNDI
```

### Expected behavior

hibernate-orm guide should mention that JNDI is disabled

### Actual behavior

hibernate-orm guide does not mention that JNDI is disabled

### How to Reproduce?

Check https://quarkus.io/guides/hibernate-orm
